page.title: 07Local History.
page.content: Our school and the estate around it are on Hough hill. The road and the wood are near Cheethams Park, and are called Early Bank. They were all owned by the Cheetham family. The Cheethams were very rich. The stone wall which separates the road and the wood was built by the Cheethams. The last of the family was Agnes Cheetham. She died at the age of ninety nine, and left the park to Tameside. She died in 1932. Many of the trees at the top of the park, are oak. Rabbits, jays and grey squirrels are some of the wildlife in the park. There are rhododendrons, and the horse chestnut, which has been growing in England for only 300 years. There is a quarry in the park. People are not allowed to go there. The old coach house is now used by the gardeners. There is a Victorian walled garden still used as a garden.
